page.title: 03INDUSTRIES OF THE PAST.
page.content:
In 1842 flax spinning was carried out at Upper Woodburn and cotton spinning at Duncrue. There was a bleach green with also wadding and cotton bands manufactured at Woodburn. These in turn were replaced by a weaving factory and bleachworks. The source of power for these factories was obtained from the Woodburn river alias Wud burn i.e. mad river.
In February 1903 the Woodburn Weaving Factory was gutted by a disastrous fire causing Â£25,000 of damage. The Belfast Fire Brigade were called out and covered the journey of 11 miles in one hour.
In September 1903 Carrickfergus got its first engine, this manual engine was replaced in 1908 with a steam fire engine.
